With today's I build I got in the debug view (may be related to bug #170377).

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
at java.lang.System.arraycopy(Native Method)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.ElementContentProvider.getElements(ElementContentProvider.java:182)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.DebugTargetContentProvider.getChildren(DebugTargetContentProvider.java:53)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.threadgroups.JavaDebugTargetContentProvider.getChildren(JavaDebugTargetContentProvider.java:51)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.ElementContentProvider.retrieveChildren(ElementContentProvider.java:86)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.elements.ElementContentProvider$1.run(ElementContentProvider.java:41)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
I'm seeing this too, running 3.3 M5 as my host, and the I20070321-0008 build as my target.  Two occurrences showed up in the host's log when exiting the target.
marking as works for me. We have not been able to reproduce. Examining the latest code, I don't see an out of bounds potential.
